repository.orgName: Staats- und Universitätsbibliothek Hamburg Carl von Ossietzky

msContents.summary:
The manuscript is a commentary on Anumānakhaṇḍa. The commentaey titled Cintāmaṇivyākhyā also known as TattvaCintāmaṇi or maṇi. It is written by Gaṅgeśa or Gaṅgeśvara. On the blank folio before the end guard folio has written in Granth: anumāna cintāmaṇīvyākhyānaṃ anumānapurvakhaṇḍaṃ.
Broken leaf after folio 222v has 2 line Witten in Granth. First line is half broken so not able to read- lānām haritakiviśvaguḍaprayuktā. Front gurad folio has written number 41 and on the sticker number 41 is printed. Numer 91 written on the sticker in blue pen. The title is carved at the centre in Granth script: Cintāmaṇivyā[khyā].

msItem.title: Cintāmaṇivyākhyā Anumānakhaṇḍa
msItem.author: Gaṅgeś

filiation.p: New Catalogus Catalogorum Vol 8: pp 19-26 Aufrecht Catalogus vol 1: p 216

msItem.rubric: (1r 1) gajānanam bhūtagaṇādhīsevitaṃ kapitthaṃ jambūphalasārabhakṣitaṃ umāsūtaṃ śoka[vināśakaraṇaṃ] namā[mi] (lacuna of approximate 9 letters.)
msItem.incipit: (1r 2) nanu maṇikṛtānumānannirupyate iti pratijñāyate tat pratijyā cedānimas? tā pratijñā….
msItem.explicit: (222r 6) tyāyeti nanu nigamane vijñānalakṣaṇaivāvaśyavā? hetutvātyathānupateratrāśiṣyatvādityāśaṃkya jñānasyāpi śakyatvāt na tatra

extent.measure: 2 guard folio 1 broken folio, 222 written folio.

supportDesc.foliation: Tamil numerals mentioned in the left margin on recto of the folio.
supportDesc.condition: Fragile. Many leaves are broken at the edges and corners.

handNote.desc: vowel u is used after the letter instead of sign of ukāra.

additions.desc: The title is carved at the centre in Granth script: Cintāmaṇivyā[khyā].
hariḥ oṃ, śubhamastu is written in the left margin on Folio 1.

listBibl.bibl: Tattvacintāmaṇi Gaṅgeśa Upādhyaya Prakāśa Rucidattamiśra Tarkacuḍāmaṇi Prakāśa vol ii part 1. Dr. N. S. Ramanuja Tatacharya, Rashtriya Sanskrit Samsthan Delhi, Kendriya Sanskrit Vidyapeeth Series 33. Kendriya Sanskrit Vidyapeetha Tirupati 1982.

encodingDesc.p: [] bracket used for supplying missing or half leggible letters. Spaces are added to separate words and question marks are used for letters which are not leggible.

TEI.text: (1r 1) gajānanam bhūtagaṇādhīsevitaṃ kapitthaṃ jambūphalasārabhakṣitaṃ umāsūtaṃ śoka[vināśakaraṇaṃ] namā[mi] (lacuna of approximate 9 letters.) (1r 2) nanu maṇikṛtānumānannirupyate iti pratijñāyate tat pratijyā cedānimas? tā pratijñā…. (222r 6) tyāyeti nanu nigamane vijñānalakṣaṇaivāvaśyavā? hetutvātyathānupateratrāśiṣyatvādityāśaṃkya jñānasyāpi śakyatvāt na tatra
